devdoc.details: Interface of the ERC20 standard as defined in the EIP.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

allowance(address,address).details: Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is zero by default. This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

approve(address,uint256).details: Sets a `value` amount of tokens as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's tokens. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729 Emits an {Approval} event.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the value of tokens owned by `account`.

totalSupply().details: Returns the value of tokens in existence.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Moves a `value` amount of tokens from the caller's account to `to`. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Moves a `value` amount of tokens from `from` to `to` using the allowance mechanism. `value` is then deducted from the caller's allowance. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

canCreateSlice(address).details: Returns whether a given address is authorized to create a Slice token.

changeApprovedSliceTokenCreator(address,.details: Adds or removes an address from the list of addresses that can create new Slice tokens

changeSliceTokenCreationEnabled(bool).details: Enables/disables the creation of new Slice tokens. Can only be called by contract owner.

params._isEnabled: If true token creation is enabled, otherwise disabled

createSlice(string,string,(uint256,addre.details: Deploys a new Slice token contract. Can only be called by verified addresses.

getRegisteredSliceToken(uint256).details: Returns a registered Slice token at the given index.

params._idx: The index in the registeredSliceTokens array.

getRegisteredSliceTokens().details: Returns all the registered Slice tokens.

getRegisteredSliceTokensCount().details: Returns the number of Slice tokens registered (created) in the contract.

isSliceTokenRegistered(address).details: Returns whether a given address is a registered slice token or not.

params._data: The data to pass to payload executor

purchaseUnderlyingAssets(bytes32,uint256.details: Purchases the underlying assets for a given slice token (msg.sender).

params._maxEstimatedPrices: The maximum estimated price for each underlying asset. In USDC (6 decimals)
params._mintID: The ID that uniquely identifies this mint transaction within the sysem
params._sliceTokenQuantity: The quantity of slice tokens to purchase the underlying assets for

redeemUnderlying(bytes32).details: Transfers out the underlying assets for a given Slice token to the given user.

params._redeemID: The ID that uniquely identifies this transaction within the system

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

allowance(address,address).details: Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is zero by default. This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

approve(address,uint256).details: Sets a `value` amount of tokens as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's tokens. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729 Emits an {Approval} event.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the value of tokens owned by `account`.

getPositions().details: Returns the Slice token's underlying positions

params._maxEstimatedPrices: The maximum estimated price of all the underlying assets combined. In USDC (6 decimals)
params._sliceTokenQuantity: The quantity of slice tokens to purchase

mintComplete(bytes32).details: Called by the SliceCore contract when a mint transaction is confirmed completed by all the cross-chain contracts

params._mintID: The ID that uniquely identifies this transaction within the system

rebalance((uint256,address,uint256)[]).details: Rebalances the underlying positions in the Slice token. Can only be called by contract owner.

params._positions: The new positions to rebalance to

rebalanceComplete(bytes32).details: Called by the SliceCore contract when a rebalance transaction is confirmed completed by all the cross-chain contracts

params._rebalanceID: The ID that uniquely identifies this transaction within the system

redeem(uint256).details: Redeems the underlying assets in a Slice token and burns the Slice token.

params._sliceTokenQuantity: The quantity of slice tokens to redeem

redeemComplete(bytes32).details: Called by the SliceCore contract when a redeem transaction is confirmed completed by all the cross-chain contracts

params._redeemID: The ID that uniquely identifies this transaction within the system

totalSupply().details: Returns the value of tokens in existence.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Moves a `value` amount of tokens from the caller's account to `to`. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Moves a `value` amount of tokens from `from` to `to` using the allowance mechanism. `value` is then deducted from the caller's allowance. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

documentation.text: @dev Interface of the ERC20 standard as defined in the EIP.

@dev Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by
 a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.
@dev Returns the value of tokens in existence.
@dev Returns the value of tokens owned by `account`.

@dev Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be
 allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is
 zero by default.
 This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

@dev Sets a `value` amount of tokens as the allowance of `spender` over the
 caller's tokens.
 Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
 IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk
 that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate
 transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race
 condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the
 desired value afterwards:
 https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729
 Emits an {Approval} event.

@dev Moves a `value` amount of tokens from `from` to `to` using the
 allowance mechanism. `value` is then deducted from the caller's
 allowance.
 Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
 Emits a {Transfer} event.

@notice Execute a payload
 @param _data The data to pass to payload executor

@dev Deploys a new Slice token contract. Can only be called by verified addresses.
 @param _positions The Slice token's underlying positions

@dev Returns whether a given address is authorized to create a Slice token.
 @param _user The address of the user

@dev Transfers out the underlying assets for a given Slice token to the given user.
 @param _redeemID The ID that uniquely identifies this transaction within the system

@dev Enables/disables the creation of new Slice tokens. Can only be called by contract owner.
 @param _isEnabled If true token creation is enabled, otherwise disabled
@dev Returns the number of Slice tokens registered (created) in the contract.
@dev Returns all the registered Slice tokens.

@dev Returns a registered Slice token at the given index.
 @param _idx The index in the registeredSliceTokens array.

@dev Returns whether a given address is a registered slice token or not.
 @param _token The address to check

@dev Called by the SliceCore contract when a mint transaction is confirmed completed by all the cross-chain contracts
 @param _mintID The ID that uniquely identifies this transaction within the system

@dev Called by the SliceCore contract when a rebalance transaction is confirmed completed by all the cross-chain contracts
 @param _rebalanceID The ID that uniquely identifies this transaction within the system

@dev Called by the SliceCore contract when a redeem transaction is confirmed completed by all the cross-chain contracts
 @param _redeemID The ID that uniquely identifies this transaction within the system
@dev Returns the Slice token's underlying positions
